intro: Astragalus chahartaghensis, commonly known as the Chahartagh milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its scientific study contributes to the understanding of plant biodiversity in its native habitat.
